eu.davidea.flexibleadapter.common

Class FlexibleItemDecoration

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ItemDecoration
      • eu.davidea.flexibleadapter.common.FlexibleItemDecoration

  • public class FlexibleItemDecoration
extends androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ItemDecoration
    This item decorator implements identical drawing technique of DividerItemDecorator from Android API, and at the same time, it adds several useful functionalities:
    • Supports all RecyclerView LayoutManagers that implement (Linear, Grid or StaggeredGrid).
    • Can add equal space offset at all sides of an item.
    • Can customize the offset for each view type.
    • Can customize the offset at the 4 edges: first and last column / first and last row.
    • Recognizes the sections of FlexibleAdapter and can add gap offset between them.
    • Recognizes the orientation of the current Layout.
    • Supports the default Android divider android.R.attr.listDivider.
    • Supports a custom divider by DrawableRes id.
    • Supports drawing the divider over or underneath the items.
    • Supports drawing the divider for specific viewTypes.
    Tip: Call the method FlexibleAdapter.invalidateItemDecorations(long) to rebuild the invalidated offsets due to the changes coming from events like moveItem or any layout change that modifies the order of the items.
    Since:
    20/07/2015 Created in main package
    23/04/2017 Drawing of the divider over or underneath the items
    26/05/2017 Rewrote the full class to support equal spaces between items in all situations
    10/09/2017 Optional view types for divider
    17/12/2017 Moved into UI package

    • Method Detail

      • withDefaultDivider

        public FlexibleItemDecoration withDefaultDivider(java.lang.Integer... viewTypes)
        Default Android divider will be used.
        Parameters:
        viewTypes - the specific ViewTypes for which the divider will be drawn OR do not specify any to draw divider for all ViewTypes (default behavior).
        Returns:
        this FlexibleItemDecoration instance so the call can be chained
        Since:
        1.0.0-b1
        See Also:
        withDivider(int, Integer...), withDrawOver(boolean), removeDivider()

      • withDivider

        public FlexibleItemDecoration withDivider(@DrawableRes
                                          int resId,
                                          java.lang.Integer... viewTypes)
        Custom divider.
        Parameters:
        resId - drawable resourceId that should be used as a divider
        viewTypes - the specific ViewTypes for which the divider will be drawn OR do not specify any to draw divider for all ViewTypes (default behavior).
        Returns:
        this FlexibleItemDecoration instance so the call can be chained
        Since:
        1.0.0-b1
        See Also:
        withDefaultDivider(Integer...), withDrawOver(boolean), removeDivider()

      • withDrawDividerOnLastItem

        public FlexibleItemDecoration withDrawDividerOnLastItem(boolean lastItem)
        Allows to draw the Divider after the last item.

        Default is false (don't draw).

        Parameters:
        lastItem - true to draw, false to not draw
        Returns:
        this FlexibleItemDecoration instance so the call can be chained
        Since:
        1.0.0-b1

      • removeDivider

        public FlexibleItemDecoration removeDivider()
        Removes any divider previously set.
        Returns:
        this FlexibleItemDecoration instance so the call can be chained
        Since:
        1.0.0-b1

      • withDrawOver

        public FlexibleItemDecoration withDrawOver(boolean drawOver)
        Changes the mode to draw the divider.

        - When false, any content will be drawn before the item views are drawn, and will thus appear underneath the views.
        - When true, any content will be drawn after the item views are drawn, and will thus appear over the views.

        Default value is false (drawn underneath).
        Parameters:
        drawOver - true to draw after the item has been added, false to draw underneath the item
        Returns:
        this Divider, so the call can be chained
        Since:
        1.0.0-b1

      • shouldDrawDivider

        protected boolean shouldDrawDivider(androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder viewHolder)
        Allows to define for which items the divider should be drawn.

        Override to define custom logic. By default all viewTypes will have the divider.

        Parameters:
        viewHolder - the ViewHolder under analysis
        Returns:
        true to draw the divider, false to skip the drawing

      • withSectionGapOffset

        public FlexibleItemDecoration withSectionGapOffset(int sectionOffset)
        Adds an extra offset at the end of each section.

        Works only with FlexibleAdapter.

        Parameters:
        sectionOffset - the extra offset at the end of each section
        Returns:
        this FlexibleItemDecoration instance so the call can be chained
        Since:
        1.0.0-b1

      • withSectionGapOnLastItem

        public FlexibleItemDecoration withSectionGapOnLastItem(boolean lastItem)
        Allows to disable the SectionGap after the last item.

        Default is true (draw).

        Parameters:
        lastItem - true to draw, false to not draw
        Returns:
        this FlexibleItemDecoration instance so the call can be chained
        Since:
        1.0.0-b1

      • withEdge

        public FlexibleItemDecoration withEdge(boolean withEdge)
        Adds an offset to the items at the 4 edges (left, top, right and bottom).

        Note: An offset OR an itemType with offsets must be added.

        Default value is false (no edge).
        Parameters:
        withEdge - true to enable, false otherwise
        Returns:
        this FlexibleItemDecoration instance so the call can be chained
        Since:
        1.0.0-b1
        See Also:
        withOffset(int), addItemViewType(int, int)

      • withLeftEdge

        public FlexibleItemDecoration withLeftEdge(boolean withLeftEdge)
        Adds an offset to the items at the Left edge.

        Note: An offset OR an itemType with offsets must be added.

        Default value is false (no edge).
        Parameters:
        withLeftEdge - true to add offset to the items at the Left of the first column.
        Returns:
        this FlexibleItemDecoration instance so the call can be chained
        Since:
        1.0.0-b1
        See Also:
        withOffset(int), addItemViewType(int, int)

        Default value is false (no edge).
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        this FlexibleItemDecoration instance so the call can be chained
        Since:
        1.0.0-b1

        withOffset(int), addItemViewType(int, int)

        this FlexibleItemDecoration instance so the call can be chained

      • addItemViewType

        public FlexibleItemDecoration addItemViewType(@LayoutRes
                                              int viewType)
        Applies the general offset also to the specified viewType.

        Call withOffset(int) to set a general offset.

        Parameters:
        viewType - the viewType affected
        Returns:
        this FlexibleItemDecoration instance so the call can be chained
        Since:
        1.0.0-b1
        See Also:
        withOffset(int), addItemViewType(int, int), removeItemViewType(int)

      • addItemViewType

        public FlexibleItemDecoration addItemViewType(@LayoutRes
                                              int viewType,
                                              int offset)
        As addItemViewType(int) but with custom offset equals to all sides that will affect only this viewType.
        Parameters:
        viewType - the viewType affected
        Returns:
        this FlexibleItemDecoration instance so the call can be chained
        Since:
        1.0.0-b1
        See Also:
        withOffset(int), removeItemViewType(int)

      • addItemViewType

        public FlexibleItemDecoration addItemViewType(@LayoutRes
                                              int viewType,
                                              int left,
                                              int top,
                                              int right,
                                              int bottom)
        As addItemViewType(int) but with custom offset that will affect only this viewType.
        Parameters:
        viewType - the viewType affected
        left - the offset to the left of the item
        top - the offset to the top of the item
        right - the offset to the right of the item
        bottom - the offset to the bottom of the item
        Returns:
        this FlexibleItemDecoration instance so the call can be chained
        Since:
        1.0.0-b1
        See Also:
        addItemViewType(int, int), removeItemViewType(int)

      • removeItemViewType

        public FlexibleItemDecoration removeItemViewType(@LayoutRes
                                                 int viewType)
        In case a viewType should not have anymore the applied offset.
        Parameters:
        viewType - the viewType to remove from the decoration management
        Returns:
        this FlexibleItemDecoration instance so the call can be chained
        Since:
        1.0.0-b1
